channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Birkin bags can double in value in 5 years. An Hermès expert explains why it’s a better investment than gold
item.description: Thanks to its exclusivity and its status as an investment piece, a Birkin bag’s value is much higher than its sticker price of around $12,000.

item.title: Science Says Marry the Right Person and You’ll Be More Successful, Except for 1 (Very Personal) Catch
item.description: Research shows the person you marry makes a huge difference where career, wealth, and health are concerned. But so does the person they marry.

item.title: Bittensor, the AI-linked cryptocurrency founded by a former Google engineer, just halved its supply. Here’s what that means
item.description: The mechanics of Bittensor mirror those of Bitcoin, the world’s largest cryptocurrency.

item.title: I lead Microsoft’s enterprise AI agent strategy. Here’s what every company should know about how agents will rewrite work
item.description: History shows that breakthrough technologies don’t just slot into existing systems, they make us rethink those systems entirely.

item.title: Snapchat Recap 2025: Here’s how and when to see your memories and ‘year-end’ story
item.description: Platforms from Amazon to YouTube —and, of course, the headline-dominating Spotify Wrapped —have spent much of December rolling out year-end recaps tha...

item.title: Where Are the Flying Cars? It Turns Out They’re Here, Delivering Ice Cream for Walmart
item.description: The flying vehicles are here. They’re just unmanned. And last week, Walmart made it official.

item.title: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky says he went to ‘night school’ for an hour every day with Barack Obama and even turned in homework
item.description: The billionaire founder admits a weekly mentorship call with the former president came with assignments like being more intentional with his friendshi...

item.title: My Employee Calls in Sick After Negative Feedback
item.description: He seems like he’s in a tailspin.

item.title: We need more data communication not data visualization
item.description: Public trust in the media and in data has been undercut by information overload, relentless social media cycles, and targeted influence campaigns. Whe...

item.title: How Trump’s tariffs are impacting prices and purchases this holiday shopping season
item.description: The Ah Louis Store in San Luis Obispo, California, turns into a winter wonderland every holiday season. Green garlands, giant nutcrackers, baubles and...

item.title: Here’s How You Can Help Your Employees With Financial Emergencies
item.description: When money is tight, an emergency expense can upend an someone’s life. Offering this simple benefit can help soften the impact.

item.title: Go Ahead—Make the Big Ask
item.description: The worst that happens is they say “no.”

item.title: Rob Reiner, famed director of ‘When Harry Met Sally,’ is dead at 78

item.title: iRobot stock price collapses as Roomba maker files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy: Here’s what happens next
item.description: Shares of iRobot Corporation (Nasdaq: IRBT), maker of the Roomba autonomous vacuum cleaner, are crashing today after the company announced that it wil...

item.title: Meetings are not work, says Southwest Airlines CEO—and he’s taking action, by blocking his calendar every afternoon from Wednesday to Friday
item.description: Southwest Airlines CEO Bob Jordan says too many execs mistake packed calendars for productivity. He’s found a ‘crazy’ solution.
